glsa.title: HPLIP: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in HPLIP, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: The Hewlett-Packard Linux Imaging and Printing system (HPLIP) provides drivers for HP's inkjet and laser printers, scanners and fax machines.

description.p: Two vulnerabilities have been found in HPLIP:

ul.li: The "hpmud_get_pml()" function in pml.c contains a boundary error which could cause a stack-based buffer overflow (CVE-2010-4267).
The "send_data_to_stdout()" function in hpcupsfax.cpp creates insecure temporary files (CVE-2011-2722).

impact.p: A remote attacker might send specially crafted SNMP reponses, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
